results.title: The Body fights disease
results.brief_description: Describes the body’s mechanisms for fighting germs and preventing illness. Deals with the existence of germs and the role of the skin, antibodies, lymphatic system and vaccination. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Animals of Asia
results.creator_credit: Centron Films and Chatsworth Film Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of animals and birds of Asia. Includes flying foxes, snakes, deer, tigers, mud skippers and orangutans. Written by Michael Boorer of the Zoological Society of London. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Physical education for children
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Faculty of Education

results.title: Christmas lace
results.creator_credit: George Mendeluk, Linda Sorensen and Ko-Zac Productions
results.brief_description: Animated at the beginning, this film is a Christmas story of a girl and her grandmother, both lacemakers, living in rural Quebec in the 1880s. A Christmas bowl left for the Baby Jesus one Christmas Eve is taken by a thief who eventually repays his debt. The film embodies some elements of French-Canadian culture. Special appearance by Monique Mercure and Marcel Sabourin. Cast includes Michael Cote, Guylaine Croteau, Germaine Lemyre and Roger Garand. Story by Linda Sorensen. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: And what of the future?
results.creator_credit: David Allen, Robert qAlbury and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Investigates some of the social consequences of microelectronics in relation to employment, the work ethic, and the individual’s right to provacy as the amount of computerized information grows.

results.title: Rice: biggest small grain on earth
results.brief_description: Contrasts the labour-intensive rice production methods of Asia with the capital-intensive rice-growing methods used in North America. Also includes information on rice processing, types of rice and nutrition.
